Posts.EditableText:
You can use RRGGBB hex values for background and foreground tags and script, by prefixing them with &H. e.g.

[code:159693j5]
background <&HFF0000>
[/code:159693j5]

will change the background to red.

But I agree that more flexible and advanced formatting is required. HTML-style formatting tags has been on my "to do" list for a number of years now...

I think any changes to the foreground colour during a game won't affect text that has already been printed, so if you wanted you could do this:


foreground <&H0080FF>
msg <Lots |xn>
foreground <&H8080FF>
msg <of |xn>
foreground <&HFF0080>
msg <pretty |xn>
foreground <&H80FF00>
msg <colours>
foreground <black>


No idea what that looks like as I'm not at a machine with Quest on it at the moment, but I think it should work.
